main event: An unidentified object was observed over Santa Maria, California on January 27, 1967, appearing brighter than the brightest star and lacking running lights.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 5 minutes., The object was reported to have a course to the southeast., The lights of the object were compared to truck headlights at a distance of approximately one block., The object disappeared when the light went out and moved behind trees., Examination of photographs revealed circular light-colored images but did not support the probability of an aircraft.
sighted object: a bright, unidentified object without running lights
witness description: The witness indicated a lack of special experiences and provided contact information for follow-up.
